page.title: 12WILLOW PL.& WYNTERS ARMOURIE
page.content: magazine racks, corner units, chairs, etc. The various stages from raw timber to veneering, staining & polishing are all done here by the 20 employees. A considerable export business is now developing . The principle woods used are beech, yew & mahogany.WYNTERS ARMOURIE{499082}.yet another building linked with William's original Domesday Book . The name may be traced as far back as Alice Wynter. 1248, fire destroyed much of the original building but it is still a fine example of a moated farmhouse and restoration completed in 1865 has been very sensitively executed. The moat extends along the east,north & west flanks and is believed to have been used for the enclosure of livestock. Unusual trees,walnut & medlar may be found here.
